subNodes.conversationText: root
"I have nothing more to discuss with you. Leave me."
"Very well."

"Ah, you have returned!" The creature can hardly hide its glee. 

Behind the Vandrid, the bloodied and dazed figure of the imp is shackled in chains amongst a small crowd of zombies.
"I did what you asked. Now you owe me a hero's soul."
"You fool, <FullName>! You can't deal with a Vandrid!"
Continue
"Oh, but you can. I keep my word, <FullName>. I will fill your Elderin Stone with the soul of a hero king as promised."
"Do it."

The Vandrid's eyes shut momentarily, and it licks its lips with a large, leathery tongue.

Your Elderin Stone sparkles into life! Holding it in your hands, you marvel at the deep colors and pulsing light now embedded deep in the stone.
Continue
"There. It is done. I believe our transaction is done, <FullName>? Perhaps you would be good enough to leave us."
"Thank you, Vandrid. I bid you farewell."
"No! You can't leave me!"
"After what you did to Dalamar this is the least you deserve. Farewell, imp."
Continue
"We're not done. I can't leave you alive."
"We had a deal!"
"A deal with you? Over souls? Don't make me laugh!"
"Read the scroll, <FullName>! Read it NOW!"
[Read the scroll]

The words are short and sharp, and you bark them out quickly.

The creature screams in pain and flails about with its staff. "Fool! Idiot! I will devour you!"
Continue
[Attack]
The Vandrid grins and strikes its staff into the earth.
Continue
"Why have you returned without the imp?"
"I'm working on it. I'll be back."
"I've changed my mind. I'm going to kill you."
"I urge you to think again about this." The creature's yellow eyes bore into you.
The creature gives off a sense of enormous power and malevolence. It moves slowly towards you on its hooves, its yellow eyes never blinking.
"Are you the Vandrid?"

The creature smiles coldly. You find yourself taking an instinctive step backwards.

"Your people know my kind as Vandrid, certainly. It is not my name, of course, but it will suit for the purposes of our conversation."
"I have no interest in talking to you."
The creature's eyes narrow. "Oh, but you do! You do! I see your mind, <FullName>. I see what you are doing. And you are a fool. The imp is lying to you."
"What do you mean?"

"Well, it told you the truth that the Elderin Stone needs a Great Soul to work. But it lied that the soul is consumed on use."

The Vandrid grins. "The soul in the Stone and the soul of the user become merged. They taint each other. If you use the soul of an evil creature to cure your king, then he will become a despot; a vicious ruler, capable of great evil. Is that what you want?"
"I don't believe you."

"Believe what you want. Read your scroll. I couldn't care less."

The creature rocks back on its hooves thoughtfully. "Although.... I could offer you a different proposal, <FullName>. Care to hear it?"
"Go on."

"I will give you a hero's soul. One of the great Elderin kings of old. A king known for his integrity and benevolence. This soul will make your king a great man, who will look after the poor and the weak and fight evil in his land. Surely this is the soul that you would want...?"
"In return for what?"

"Go to the imp.Tell it that you have done as it asked. Tell it you have killed me, and that it is safe to come down here once more. Send it into my lair. The imp and I have unfinished business, and I desire very much to see it again."

"Do this, and I will give you the hero king's soul."
"No deal."
"I urge you to think again about this." The creature's yellow eyes bore into you.
[Attack the Vandrid]
The Vandrid grins and strikes its staff into the earth.
Continue
[Read the Scroll]

The words are short and sharp, and you bark them out quickly.

The creature screams in pain and flails about with its staff. "Fool! Idiot! I will devour you!"
Continue
"That's all? I just need to send the Imp here?"

"That's all. No more fighting. I give you my word."

"Do this, and you get a hero's soul for your stone, and you get to leave with your life. That is the deal. And it is a good deal... you would be wise to accept."
"No deal."
"I urge you to think again about this." The creature's yellow eyes bore into you.
"I will do it. I will tell the imp that you are dead and that the path is clear."
"Good, good! Do this and return to me."
Continue

"Ah, you have returned!" The creature can hardly hide its glee. 

Behind the Vandrid, the bloodied and dazed figure of Dalamar is held in chains, kneeling in defeat amongst a small crowd of zombies.
"I did what you asked. Now you owe me a hero's soul."
"You fool, <FullName>! You can't deal with a Vandrid!"
Continue
"Oh, but you can. I keep my word, <FullName>. I will fill your Elderin Stone with the soul of a hero king as promised."
"Do it."

The Vandrid's eyes shut momentarily, and it licks its lips with a large, leathery tongue.

Your Elderin Stone sparkles into life! Holding it in your hands, you marvel at the deep colors and pulsing light now embedded deep in the stone.
Continue
"There. It is done. I believe our transaction is done, <FullName>? Perhaps you would be good enough to leave us."
"Thank you, Vandrid. I bid you farewell."
"No! You can't leave me!"
"Farewell, Dalamar."
"No. I can't leave Dalamar with you."
"We had a deal!"
"A deal with you? Over souls? Don't make me laugh!"
"Read the scroll, <FullName>! Read it NOW!"
[Read the scroll]

The words are short and sharp, and you bark them out quickly.

The creature screams in pain and flails about with its staff. "Fool! Idiot! I will devour you!"
Continue
[Attack]
The creature grins and strikes its staff into the earth.
Continue
"How do I know I can trust you?"
"You have my word. Is that not enough? I have everything I want, and this soul means little to me."
"Very well. Do it."

The Vandrid's eyes shut momentarily, and it licks its lips with a large, leathery tongue.

Your Elderin Stone sparkles into life! Holding it in your hands, you marvel at the deep colors and pulsing light now embedded deep in the stone.
"Why have you returned without Dalamar?"
"I'm working on it. I'll be back."
"I've changed my mind. I'm going to kill you."
"I urge you to think again about this." The creature's yellow eyes bore into you.
The creature gives off a sense of enormous power and malevolence. It moves slowly towards you on its hooves, its yellow eyes never blinking.
"Are you the Vandrid?"

The creature smiles coldly. You find yourself taking an instinctive step backwards.

"Your people know my kind as Vandrid, certainly. It is not my name, of course, but it will suit for the purposes of our conversation."
"I have no interest in talking to you."

The creature's eyes narrow. "Oh, but you do! You do! I see your mind, <FullName>. I see what you are doing. And you are a fool. Dalamar is lying to you, and whatever happens down here, he intends to kill you."
"What do you mean?"

"Firstly, that scroll in your pocket is useless. Try it if you like. All it will do is hold your party in place so I can feast on you. And I feast slowly these days... I would make you last for the next century."
Continue

"Secondly, he told you the truth that the Elderin Stone needs a Great Soul to work. But he lied that the soul is consumed on use."

The creature grins. "The soul in the Stone and the soul of the user become merged. They taint each other. If you use the soul of an evil creature to cure your king, then he will become a despot; a vicious ruler, capable of great evil. Is that what you want?"
"I don't believe you."

"Believe what you want. Read your scroll. I couldn't care less."

The creature rocks back on its hooves thoughtfully. "Although.... I could offer you a different proposal, <FullName>. Care to hear it?"
"Go on."

"I will give you a hero's soul. One of the great Elderin kings of old. A king known for his integrity and benevolence. This soul will make your king a great man, who will look after the poor and the weak and fight evil in his land. Surely this is the soul that you would want...?"
"In return for what?"

"Go to Dalamar. Tell him that you have done as he asked. Tell him you have killed me, and that it is safe to come down here once more. Send him into my lair. I will rest better knowing that he is no longer a threat to me."

"Do this, and I will give you the hero king's soul."
"No deal."
"I urge you to think again about this." The creature's yellow eyes bore into you.
[Attack]
The creature grins and strikes its staff into the earth.
Continue
[Read the Scroll]

The words are short and sharp, and you bark them out quickly.

The creature screams in pain and flails about with its staff. "Fool! Idiot! I will devour you!"
Continue
"All I need to do is bring Dalamar down here?"

"That's all. No more fighting. I give you my word."

"Do this, and you get a hero's soul for your stone, and you get to leave with your life. That is the deal. And it is a good deal... you would be wise to accept."
"That's all? I just need to send Dalamar here?"

"That's all. No more fighting. I give you my word."

"Do this, and you get a hero's soul for your stone, and you get to leave with your life. That is the deal. And it is a good deal... you would be wise to accept."
"No deal."
"I urge you to think again about this." The creature's yellow eyes bore into you.
"I will do it. I will tell Dalamar that you are dead and that the path is clear."
"Good, good! Do this and return to me."
Continue
